page.title: 01OVER WYRESDALE: INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area lies in the parishes of Over Wyresdale, Nether Wyresdale and Ellel in north Lancashire, in the parliamentary borough of Lancaster. Bordering the villages of Dolphinholme to the west and Abbeystead to the east it lies south of Lancaster, about 10 kilometres from the coast. It is drained westward by tne river Wyre. It is a sparsely populated rural area,with a strong community feeling. The settlement consists mainly of scattered farms with some more recently built houses in the west. A few of the farmers own their land but many of the others are tenants of the Grosvenor Estates. Most of this land is cultivated grassland used for feeding sheep or cattle but there is also a large area of woodland managed primarily as cover for gamebirds. There is no industry in this area.
